snippet: A sudden round of finger-pointing in the American intelligence community this week also highlighted the sensitivity surrounding nuclear threats in the wake of failures in Iraq.
abstract: American Intelligence community's contrasting views about North Korea's nuclear capability seems to underscore difficulty of obtaining reliable information about one of world’s most closed societies; also highlight sensitivity around intelligence estimates in wake of highly publicized intelligence failures leading up to Iraq war, and some subsequent failures involving North Korea.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: A sudden round of finger-pointing in the American intelligence community this week also highlighted the sensitivity surrounding nuclear threats in the wake of failures in Iraq.

headline.main: Contrasting Views on North Korea Underscore Sensitivities and Lack of Evidence
headline.print_headline: Contrasting Views on North Korea Underscore Sensitivities and Lack of Evidence

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
